Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2012 12:17PM terri40 wrote: Hi, I'm new to this so please forgive me if my knowledge is a bit limited.  I have had a lump for five years, it occured a year after i finished breast feeding my daughter.  At the time the Radiologist said it was nothing, just my breast returning to normal and that was the end of it.  I am now experiencing pain, discharge and my Doctor is concerned that the radiologist never ordered a biopsey of the lump. I have just completed a big research project on Breast Cancer for a course i was doing and one thing I found was dense breast tissue (ie smaller breast) is harder to see suspect lumps so go into your Dr's armed with this.  Maybe your hospital has a thermogram?  Ask the question. Best thoughts to you, I know how your are feeling.
Posts.Title: palpable mass - negative mammogram bkala SpecialK
